text: I’ve used all those (though not at the same time). Any issues you are having or just curious?
Anyone have a good way of using field validation (or even a library they have used) on HubSpot forms when using the form module (not an embed)?

honestly I just do CSS based field validation. HubSpot does the other validation like valid emails and whatnot already.
<https://alligator.io/css/styling-form-input-validity/>

If say you need to use regex to test for something HS cannot, I would likely make the visible form a dummy non HS form, and make it so it’s fields map to a HS form and it’s submission actually submits the HS form
then you can do whatever you want with the form not worrying about HS’s handling of it
I'm not sure the making a dummy form is ideal as you would have to do it for every form you work with, so if a client has alot of forms, it would be alot of manual work to make it happen
this would be for things like postal code and phone number

well theoretically you could do it dynamically. use JS to catch once the form renders, grab it’s html duplicate it basically, hide the original, then make all the modifications it needs to to the dummy form. (would be harder to do though)
I think it might just have to done using the embed option and a custom module :disappointed: welp, more work for me lol
nope, it was the normal form module from HubSpot on a non-coded template the client is using

Anyone else having an issue where public_common.js stopped getting displayed by `standard_footer_includes`. Tracking code is still getting displayed but instead of public_common.js there is another script I am not familiar with: `/hs/hsstatic/HubSpotToolsMenu/static-1.9/js/index.js`. Currently this breaks our site.

looks like this was rolled out to all sites. i recommend you check functionality of your sites in case you were relying on public_common.js. we're seeing a bunch of console errors on the sites we're looking at
just got off the phone with HubSpot support and theyre looking into it
I’m seeing the file but no issues
guessing they overhauled their code for the sprocket menu
hopefully its an easy quick fix. ill report back if there's anything worth reporting
We've rolled back to fix the above- `public_common.js` should be loading again. Sorry about that!

<@UBFA10FMF> can you please explain what happened? This issue took out site out for an entire day. We also would like to understand what HubSpot is doing to prevent things like this from happening in the future.
